item.title: Windows 10 KB5062554 update breaks emoji panel search feature
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The search feature for the Windows 10 emoji panel is broken after installing the KB5062554 cumulative update released Tuesday, making it not possible to look up emojis by name or keyword. [...]

item.title: Google Gemini flaw hijacks email summaries for phishing
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google Gemini for Workspace can be exploited to generate email summaries that appear legitimate but include malicious instructions or warnings that direct users to phishing sites without using attachments or direct links. [...]

item.title: Hackers are exploiting critical RCE flaw in Wing FTP Server
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers have started to exploit a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Wing FTP Server just one day after technical details on the flaw became public. [...]

item.title: '123456' password exposed chats for 64 million McDonald’s job chatbot applications
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers discovered a vulnerability in McHire, McDonald's chatbot job application platform, that exposed the chats of more than 64 million job applications across the United States. [...]

item.title: Exploits for pre-auth Fortinet FortiWeb RCE flaw released, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Proof-of-concept exploits have been released for a critical SQLi vulnerability in Fortinet FortiWeb that can be used to achieve pre-authenticated remote code execution on vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: WordPress Gravity Forms developer hacked to push backdoored plugins
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The popular WordPress plugin Gravity Forms has been compromised in what seems a supply-chain attack where manual installers from the official website were infected with a backdoor. [...]

item.title: NVIDIA shares guidance to defend GDDR6 GPUs against Rowhammer attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: NVIDIA is warning users to activate System Level Error-Correcting Code mitigation to protect against Rowhammer attacks on graphical processors with GDDR6 memory. [...]

item.title: The zero-day that could've compromised every Cursor and Windsurf user
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Koi Security
item.description: Learn how one overlooked flaw in OpenVSX discovered by Koi Secureity could've let attackers hijack millions of dev machines via an extension supply chain attack. The zero-day threat's been patched—but the wake-up call is clear: extensions are a new, massive supply chain risk. [...]

item.title: CISA tags Citrix Bleed 2 as exploited, gives agencies a day to patch
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency has confirmed active exploitation of the CitrixBleed 2 vulnerability (CVE-2025-5777) in Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway and is giving federal agencies one day to apply fixes. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 now uses JScript9Legacy engine for improved security
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft announced that it has replaced the default scripting engine JScript with the newer and more secure JScript9Legacy on Windows 11 version 24H2 and later. [...]

item.title: Russian pro basketball player arrested for alleged role in ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Russian professional basketball player Daniil Kasatkin was arrested in France at the request of the United States for allegedly acting as a negotiator for a ransomware gang. [...]
